00006 #include <stdio.h>
00007 #include "gd.h"
00008 
00009 #include <WFileResource>
00010 
00011 #include "CornerImage.h"
00012 
00013 CornerImage::CornerImage(Corner c, WColor fg, WColor bg,
00014                          int radius, WContainerWidget *parent)
00015   : WImage(parent),
00016     corner_(c),
00017     fg_(fg),
00018     bg_(bg),
00019     radius_(radius),
00020     resource_(0)
00021 {
00022   compute();
00023 }
00024 
00025 CornerImage::~CornerImage()
00026 {
00027   if (resource_) {
00028     unlink(resource_->fileName().c_str());
00029     delete resource_;
00030   }
00031 }
00032 
00033 void CornerImage::setRadius(int radius)
00034 {
00035   if (radius != radius_) {
00036     radius_ = radius;
00037     compute();
00038   }
00039 }
00040 
00041 void CornerImage::setForeground(WColor color)
00042 {
00043   if (fg_ != color) {
00044     fg_ = color;
00045     compute();
00046   }
00047 }
00048 
00049 #ifdef WIN32
00050 // Hmm. The precompiled libgd is useless for saving files in MSVC > 6.
00051 // This is the proposed solution from the FAQ.
00052 // TODO: sensible error handling.
00053 static void mySavePng(gdImagePtr im, FILE *out)
00054 {
00055   int size;
00056   char *data;
00057   data = (char *) gdImagePngPtr(im, &size);
00058   if (!data) {
00059     return;
00060     /* Error */
00061   }
00062   if (fwrite(data, 1, size, out) != size) {
00063     return;
00064     /* Error */
00065   }
00066   gdFree(data);  
00067 }
00068 #else
00069 #define mySavePng gdImagePng
00070 #endif
00071 
00072 void CornerImage::compute()
00073 {
00074   /* We want an anti-aliased image: oversample twice */
00075   int AA = 2;
00076 
00077   gdImagePtr imBig = gdImageCreate(radius_ * AA, radius_ * AA);
00078 
00079   /* automatically becomes the background color -- gd documentation */
00080   gdImageColorAllocate(imBig, bg_.red(), bg_.green(), bg_.blue());
00081 
00082   int fgColor
00083     = gdImageColorAllocate(imBig, fg_.red(), fg_.green(), fg_.blue());
00084 
00085   int cx, cy;
00086 
00087   if (corner_ & Top)
00088     cy = radius_ * AA - 1;
00089   else
00090     cy = 0;
00091 
00092   if (corner_ & Left)
00093     cx = radius_ * AA - 1;
00094   else
00095     cx = 0;
00096 
00097   gdImageFilledArc(imBig, cx, cy, (radius_*2 - 1) * AA, (radius_*2 - 1) * AA,
00098                    0, 360, fgColor, gdArc);
00099 
00100   /* now create the real image, downsampled by a factor of 2 */
00101   gdImagePtr im = gdImageCreateTrueColor(radius_, radius_);
00102   gdImageCopyResampled(im, imBig, 0, 0, 0, 0, im->sx, im->sy,
00103                        imBig->sx, imBig->sy);
00104 
00105   /* and save it in a new temporary file */
00106 #ifndef WIN32
00107   char tmpFile[20];
00108   strcpy(tmpFile, "/tmp/wt.ci.XXXXXX");
00109   int fd = mkstemp(tmpFile);
00110   FILE *pngout = fdopen(fd, "wb");
00111 #else
00112   char tmpFile[2 * L_tmpnam];
00113   tmpnam(tmpFile);
00114   FILE *pngout = fopen(tmpFile, "wb");
00115 #endif
00116 
00117   mySavePng(im, pngout);
00118 
00119   fclose(pngout);
00120 
00121   gdImageDestroy(im);
00122   gdImageDestroy(imBig);
00123 
00124   if (resource_) {
00125     /* delete the previous temporary file */
00126     unlink(resource_->fileName().c_str());
00127     resource_->setFileName(tmpFile);
00128   } else {
00129     /* create and set the file resource that contains the image */
00130     resource_ = new WFileResource("image/png", tmpFile);
00131     setResource(resource_);
00132   }
00133 }
